channel.title: github on I Prefer Jim
channel.description: Recent content in github on I Prefer Jim

item.title: iggy: ignore file processor for jvm
item.description: As a core team member for Swagger Codegen, one of the major features I’ve added in the last year was support for .

item.title: Prototyping a Flags/Bitmasks implementation in Kotlin 1.1.1
item.description: One of my more favorite features of C# is the use of FlagsAttribute. If you’re not familiar with the concept, [Flags] allows you to treat an integral enum type as a bitmask.

item.title: Coding against a composed docker environment
item.description: Microservices are pretty big these days. Unfortunately, they add complexity to development, deployment, and maintenance. For instance, how do you code against multiple dependencies locally?

item.title: Ignoring files with Swagger Codegen
item.description: I’m proud to announce that I’m now a member of the Swagger Codegen Core team. I’ve previously refactored the C# client, the maven plugin, added an ASP.

item.title: Create configurable Angular services using providers
item.description: With Angular 2 on its way, it seems like a lot of developers are now afraid of Angular 1.x. I have nothing bad to say about Angular.

item.title: Decorating directives with isolate scope in Angular 1.3
item.description: A question from reddit excited my interest. Angular 1.3 apparently has broken the ability to decorate isolate scopes. I tried version of Angular between the 1.

item.title: Your First App: Node.js is complete!
item.description: I’m stoked to announce that I’ve finished writing my first self-published book, Your First App: node.js. The book is a full-stack application development tutorial using what is commonly known as the ‘MEAN’ stack, but with a heavier focus on the backend technologies: node.

item.title: Hard link in OS X
item.description: Under linux, I used mount --bind olddir newdir to link a source code directory from a git repository in my Dropbox folder to another public git repository.

item.title: Release: New Tab Redirect 3.0
item.description: On Wednesday, I began the rollout of New Tab Redirect 3.0 with some bug fixes and a huge new feature: a built in ‘Apps’ page.

item.title: prepare-commit-msg showing branch name
item.description: It’s been a while since my last post because my wife and I had a baby boy, Jack, on 11/12/13. I thought it was about time to share something simple yet effective that I use every day, a prepare-commit-msg git hook.

item.title: Karma error: RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
item.description: I’ve been working on a bootstrap application for express.js, angular.js, and bootstrap. The idea being that I can provide a boilerplate for quick prototyping of applications.

item.title: git prepare-commit-msg with node.js
item.description: I think people often overlook using node.js as a scripting tool like ruby or python. If you search the web for examples of customized git hooks, you’ll probably have visited git-scm.

item.title: git push: fatal: unable to read SHA1
item.description: Today, I was faced with an interesting error in a git repository. I am backing up a lot of old projects from during and after college into a private git repo.

item.title: Mastering Node: Addons and FunctionTemplate (uuid.node)
item.description:
Last night, I pushed an addition to my fork of Mastering Node. I decided to add a bit to the Addons chapter. The first example in this chapter only shows how to add a function to a natively-compiled module (i.e. an addon). This example shows you how to start a module which can be used in the following way:

var Uuid = require('./uuid.node').Uuid;
var uuid = new Uuid();
var myId = uuid.generate();

The project files referenced in the following text can be downloaded from the repo: jimschubert/masteringnode

FunctionTemplate

In v8, a FunctionTemplate is used to create the equivalent to:

var template = function() {

The function at this point is an object and not an instance of the function.

As an example, we will use the linux package uuid to generate a uuid. We will define the header for this addon as:

item.title: words.pl: slogan word generator
item.description: About a year ago, I was really into playing this game online where you were given a single sentence and you had to use the letters in that sentence to make up as many words as possible.

item.title: dotfiles backup using GitHub
item.description: I was recently looking for a solution to backup my configuration files (bash, vim, etc) using GitHub. After some looking around, I’ve compiled a pretty nice project for myself.

item.title: jQuery plugin: fixed table header
item.description: Here’s a plugin that I wrote a while ago for fixing a table’s header row on scroll. This code is also available as a gist.

item.title: Mercurial and Git in one repository
item.description: I have a personal project hosted at bitbucket using Mercurial as the version control system. Since I started that project, I’ve been using GitHub for everything.

item.title: jquery.empuzzle @github
item.description: For the past few days, I’ve been writing this plugin called jquery.empuzzle. It was inspired by ‘Jigsy’ at cityposh.com. It is a basic N-puzzle

item.title: Quake tracker is now officially open-source
item.description: Go here, fork it. https://github.com/jimschubert/quaketracker

item.title: Mastering Node
item.description: I’ve forked a project at github called “Mastering Node”. https://github.com/jimschubert/masteringnode I’ve wanted to familiarize myself with node.js for some time, and this seems to be the best way.

item.title: Select Actions Update (Google Chrome Extension)
item.description: Last night, I published a major update to the Select Actions Google Chrome Extension. This update removes some “scary” permissions which claimed the extension had access to all websites.
